title: [K-12] Nonlinear Pedagogy-Based Strategies for Improving Decision-Making and Performance in Adolescent Soccer Players

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of sports science, youth education experience, and team sports coaching experience
context.additional_context: A Course Focused on Developing Strategies Applicable to Actual Youth Soccer Training Settings, Conducting Practical Material Sharing and Discussions in Smartphone-Centric Limited-Technology Environments

learning_goals: Learners can understand the core principles of nonlinear pedagogy and apply them to small-scale game-based training.
Three specific indicators can be proposed to evaluate decision-making skills in adolescent soccer players
Practical training programs can be designed and feedback collected through online practice sessions in a limited technical environment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
